Containers.Name: KeepLocal-Stack
Containers.Description:
KeepLocal - A self-hosted notes application inspired by Google Keep.
This template uses Docker Compose to deploy the complete stack including: - MongoDB database - Node.js backend server - React frontend with Nginx
INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS: 1. Install "Docker Compose Manager" plugin from Community Applications 2. Go to Docker tab, click "Compose" button 3. Create new stack named "keeplocal" 4. Copy the docker-compose.yml from: https://github.com/zwaetschge/KeepLocal 5. Update ALLOWED_ORIGINS to include your Unraid IP 6. Click "Compose Up" 7. Access at http://[UNRAID-IP]:3000
Containers.Overview:
KeepLocal - A self-hosted notes application inspired by Google Keep.
Features: - Create, edit, and delete notes with confirmation dialogs - 10 different colors for your notes - Pin/unpin functionality - Tags/categories for better organization - Full-text search in title and content - Dark mode with theme persistence - Responsive design (works on desktop and mobile) - MongoDB database integration - Advanced security (XSS protection, CORS, Rate Limiting) - Toast notifications for better feedback
This is a Docker Compose stack. You need the "Docker Compose Manager" plugin.
